conclusion: Define coordinate system with O as origin, AB as y-axis, ON as x-axis.
Coordinates and distances of points A, B, M from O are given.
Distance from either charge to the ball at M is calculated as 2L.
Magnitude of repulsive force exerted by charge at A (or B) on the ball is F0 = kQ^2/(4L^2).
Line AM makes a 45-degree angle with the vertical.
Vertical component of force from A is F0 * sqrt(2)/2 upward.
Horizontal component of force from A is F0 * sqrt(2)/2 toward the right.
Horizontal components of forces from A and B cancel each other.
Net electric force at M is sqrt(2) * kQ^2/(4L^2) upward.
Final answer: Magnitude of electric force on ball at M is sqrt(2) * kQ^2/(4L^2).
